channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NV
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NV

item.title: Report X-2024030047
item.description:
Report X-2024030047

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-08T18:13:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-27
  • City: SPARKS
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED FOR A LEAKING PACKAGE ON A SIDE UNLOAD. RESPONDER GRABBED SPILL CART WALKED TO DOOR 2 PACKAGE WAS IN IRREG CHUTE LEAKING. RESPONDER CLEANED UP SPILL BROUGHT BACK TO DMP TO PROCESS LEAKING PACKAGE

item.title: Report X-2024021857
item.description:
Report X-2024021857

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-05T15:11:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-26
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: IB sort discovered leaking hazmat during unloading. Spill was contained in a red hazmat tote. DescribePack: Only paper was used as padding for the inside of box. Inner bottle was found on its side inside packaging. Cap was loose and seal was corroded, causing leakage into and out of container. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Spill was contained in red hazmat tote and subsequently brought to the hazmat cage for processing.
